reviewText:
Jump only feels like working some times and if you can live with playing a platformer with that feature this is the game for you. Or if you would like to keep your sanity id say avoid this.

I do state this as someone who did finish it and it isnt the worst game but i feel whatever engine they used ate my inputs way too many times that it was hard to enjoy the game.

Sure if you got it as a game in a bundle its fine but i couldnt recommend anyone buying this for full price or even close to full price.

reviewText: THis is actually a pretty challenging, pretty fun puzzle platformer. I've gotten through a small chunk of the game, and I quite liked what I saw so far. It's pretty well polished, too.

(I played this with an XBOX 360 controller)

The game is a puzzle platformer that has a Megaman Battle Network vibe going through it with a cute main character added in. Your goal in each stage is to collect blue and green, my eyes saw these as orange, chips. By pressing buttons you alternate which ones you can collect and which ones will kill you if you touch them.

There are three flaws, you can't go backwards once you select a world, you can't tell which levels you have beat.
Look at my time played, that is how long it took me to beat the game using the third flaw of the game. If you don't want to play all the levels choose the 10th level of each world and beat it to go to the next world.
